intro: Gomphostemma taiwanense, commonly known as Taiwan ghostpipe, is a climbing vine native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release winged seeds, aiding in wind dispersal. Gomphostemma taiwanense is often found in moist, shaded forest environments, where it thrives in the undergrowth.
